/notes/##RACK_ID##.note1: This is the battery management system (BMS) config template file for Risen
/notes/##RACK_ID##.note1a: /assets/bms/##RACK_ID##            - defines the web UI for the battery rack. Battery rack-related statuses, controls, and faults/alarms are displayed on the UI
/notes/##RACK_ID##.note1b: /config/##RACK_ID##                - defines configurable variables used in the ESS Controller source code
/notes/##RACK_ID##.note1d: /status/##RACK_ID##                - defines the status variables for the battery rack
/notes/##RACK_ID##.note1e: /components/[id]                   - defines the interface for retrieving data for the battery rack from the BMS hardware and converting the data into a useable format (ex.: scaling, remap, etc.)
/notes/##RACK_ID##.note1f: /links/##RACK_ID##                 - defines mapping of external interface components to internal variables
/notes/##RACK_ID##.note1g: /vlinks/##RACK_ID##                - allows two variables to share the same value
/notes/##RACK_ID##.note1i: /schedule/wake_monitor/##RACK_ID## - periodically runs a function for a particular variable (default to 100ms; wake_monitor to be removed)
/notes/##RACK_ID##.note1j: /faults/##RACK_ID##                - defines battery rack-related faults reported by the ESS Controller
/notes/##RACK_ID##.note1k: /alarms/##RACK_ID##                - defines battery rack-related alarms reported by the ESS Controller
/notes/##RACK_ID##.note2: To retrieve data from the BMS hardware, the modbus communication protocol will be used. To connect via modbus, use the modbus client (bms_modbus_client.json)

EnableRack.note: Enable command to send to battery rack if the rack is disabled and the dc contactors are opened

DisableRack.note: Disable command to send to battery rack if the rack is enabled and the dc contactors are opened

VerifyRackEnabled.note: Verify that the battery rack is now enabled when the enable rack command is sent

VerifyRackDisabled.note: Verify that the battery rack is now disabled when the disable rack command is sent

DCClosed.note: To modify: enable/disable monitoring check for RackCurrent if bms dc contactors are closed and pcs is running

EnableRackSuccess.note: Validation variable is set if the command value in /controls/bms:EnableRack is successfully/unsuccessfully set

remap.outValue: Failed to send/verify enable command (1) to battery rack

DisableRackSuccess.note: Validation variable is set if the command value in /controls/bms:DisableRack is successfully/unsuccessfully set

remap.outValue: Failed to send/verify disable command (2) to battery rack

VerifyRackEnabledSuccess.note: If the battery rack failed to transition to enabled state after an elasped time, send an alarm

VerifyRackDisabledSuccess.note: If the battery rack failed to transition to disabled state after an elasped time, send an alarm

rack_alarm_info.note9: Bit8: Disconnector Open when Rack Enabled
